As you can see from the image below of an actual Sudoku grid, each Sudoku grid comes with a few spaces already filled in; the more spaces filled in, the easier the game â€“ the more difficult Sudoku puzzles have very few spaces that are already filled in.

This means that we should ignore the upper left square for now, and try to fill in spaces in some other areas of the grid instead.
